page.title: 07EDUCATION AT STOKE ON TERN
page.content: {SCHOOL HISTORY Stoke on Tern school was built in 1870 . About one thousand children have been through it. Much has happened during its history.Most of the time it was in a very bad condition.The toilets weren't properly built and the school depended on a water pump. The porches were used as air raid shelters during the war.There was a well in the middle of the playground, this hasn't been examined for 40 years. Most schools took in children from the age of 5 to 14 following the 1870 Education Act. Ours took children up to this age.There was only 1 teacher for all the children,about 60 to a class.Stoke on Tern school became a two teacher school in 1943 when there were 51 children there to teach.In 1955 it became a three teacher school
